claim_summary: Email preserved verbatim as part of 47240214305 thread.

cues.speaker: Arran SHAVE <Arran.SHAVE1@norfolk.police.uk>
cues.quote:
Hi Jon
Thank you for your help with this. DOUBLE is a registered sex offender and subject to the Sex
offenders registration conditions, one of which is that he has to complete his weekly registration as
he is NFA. DOUBLE has breached this on 2 occasions, details below:
1. 36/7202/25 – DOUBLE last registered on the 18/1/2025 and was therefore due to notify by the
25/1/2025. He failed to do so and is therefore in breach of the requirement above.
2. 36/543/25 - On 03/01/2025 PPU attended DOUBLE'S registered address of his mothers in
Norwich 45, Tiercel Avenue, Norwich, NR78JN, where we were informed that he had not
stayed there since the 7th December. Upon speaking with DOUBLE to find out his
whereabouts he confirmed that he was living NFA in Great Yarmouth and confirmed he had not
registered this therefore he has breached his notification requirements.
I have included a small interview plan for the few questions required if you don’t mind. I have also
attached a copy Sex offender requirements
I have spoken to my supervisor Ds Charmaine MORTON, if you are looking to charge him with
anything then a charging decision can be drawn up here. If your looking to bail him for yours then we
are happy if you either bail him to myself with no conditions or release him under investigation again
to myself and we will look to PR him at a later date.
If he is released please inform him that he needs to register straight away at a designated police
station in the area he is living so he can be managed by the Public protection team in that area,
again if he fails to complete this he will be in breach again.
In case he suggests his mothers address for bail, we spoke with her yesterday she does not want
him there.
Thank you again for your help with this.
Regards
Arran
Dc 2157 Arran SHAVE
Public Protection Unit.
Norfolk Constabulary
Broadland Gate
Maple Way
Postwick
Norwich
NR13 5HB
